entry.value: This template shows you how to manually create the StructType of the result data frame.
// Your custom imports:%%00010import java.util.List;%%00010import org.apache.spark.sql.Row;%%00010import java.util.ArrayList;%%00010

// Enter your code here:%%00010%%00010%%00009final SparkSession spark = SparkSession.builder().sparkContext(sc.sc()).getOrCreate();%%00010%%00009final StructField fields[] = new StructField[] {%%00010%%00009%%00009DataTypes.createStructField("col1", DataTypes.StringType, false),%%00010%%00009%%00009DataTypes.createStructField("col2", DataTypes.DoubleType, false),%%00010%%00009%%00009DataTypes.createStructField("col3", DataTypes.IntegerType, false),%%00010%%00009%%00009DataTypes.createStructField("col4", DataTypes.LongType, false)%%00010%%00009};%%00010%%00009final StructType schema = DataTypes.createStructType(fields);%%00010%%00009%%00010%%00009final List<Row> rows = new ArrayList<>();%%00010%%00009rows.add(RowFactory.create(new Object[] { "a", 0.1, 2, 3l }));%%00010%%00010%%00009return spark.createDataFrame(rows, schema);%%00010%%00010
